75y black knitting in the round dpn or circs 16 color b - 37y dark grey k2tog if using alternative crown color c - 37y light grey knitting notes this pattern is a great introduction to fair isle knitting there aren t any long floats and the pattern is easily adaptable to many color mixes - there are four alternative palettes below to try out don t forget to take color dominance into consideration when doing fair isle color design - whichever yarn is held to the left will pop a bit more if you are a right handed knitter for this pattern i make sure that color b/c are the dominant colors additionally the pattern also includes an alternative crown - by alternating decreases with ssk/k2tog you create 8 straight decreases instead of the usual spiral found in most patterns you can use either crown and will end up with a great hat appalachian trail mat kladney -
